definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: May be your eloquence and good, right?
sentences.chinese: 可能是你的口才好，對不對？

sentences.english: Warren Buffett has a reputation as a bit of a wordsmith;
sentences.chinese: 沃倫巴菲特的口才出衆是出了名的。

sentences.english: His eloquent speech has won him the favor of the .
sentences.chinese: 他的好口才爲他贏得了選民的青睞。

sentences.english: No one can rival him in eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 沒人能敵得過他的口才。
他是故事大王，天生的好口才。

sentences.english: Aquarians are very friendly people, great conversationalists and thinkers.
sentences.chinese: 寶瓶座的人非常友好，是個口才絕佳的思想家。

sentences.english: The subject of his sermon was charity.
sentences.chinese: 他頗有口才，講題是“慈善”。

sentences.english: He's an eloquent man, smartly dressed in a three-piece suit.
sentences.chinese: 他口才很好，穿着得體的三件套西服。

sentences.english: A few sentences should be enough to clear the matter.
sentences.chinese: 好在她口才好，只要幾句話就把事情解釋清楚了。

sentences.english: He has liked reading since his childhood, so he excels in both writing and debating.
sentences.chinese: 他從小就喜愛閱讀，是以文筆口才都好。

sentences.english: When it comes to speech eloquence, some under-educated people also have something on the ball.
sentences.chinese: 論到講話口才，有些沒有多少文化的人還真挺能說的。

sentences.english: The audience was drawn to the speaker by his eloquence.
sentences.chinese: 聽衆被講演者的口才所吸引。

sentences.english: If you can persuade Henry to marry, you must have the address of a Frenchwoman.
sentences.chinese: 你要想說服亨利結婚，非得有法國女人的口才不可。

sentences.english: His eloquent speech has won him the favor of the electorate.
sentences.chinese: 他的好口才爲他贏得了選民的青睞。

sentences.english: That in every thing ye are enriched by him, in all utterance, and in all knowledge;
sentences.chinese: 又因你們在他裏面凡事富足，口才知識都全備。

sentences.english: I want to know how to have the gift of gab.
sentences.chinese: 我很想知道怎樣纔能有好口才。

definition: can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
eloquent and fluent speaker (idiom); grandiloquence/the gift of the gab
to have a silver tongue/to have the gift of the gab
pinyin: san1 cun4 bu4 lan4 zhi1 she2

definition: clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
lit. to have a tongue like a reed (idiom)/fig. to have a glib tongue
literary talent/literary grace/rich and bright colors
quick witted/able to think fast in an emergency
emotional quotient (EQ)/emotional IQ/abbr. for 情緒商數|情绪商数[qing2 xu4 shang1 shu4]
